title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 21 ยง 4243.25 - Eligible uses
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 21 ยง 4243.25 - Eligible uses

State Regulations
(a) Grants may
be made for regional and industrial planning studies for: (1)
preparation of strategic plans for local
and or regional economic development; (2)
the analysis of business
sectors; (3)
marketing and
promoting regional business clusters; and
(4)
feasibility studies. (b) Grants for economic development
initiatives may be made for the following purposes: (1)
the identification of new business
opportunities; (2)
planning for new
enterprise development; and
(3)
the
management of economic development projects provided that the corporation could
not undertake such project. (c) Program funds for regional and industrial
planning studies and economic development initiatives may not be used for any
ineligible costs. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 21
ยง
4243.25

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
